Similarly Many to Many associations are handled using a Through entity which will have a corresponding OneToMany relations against the two entities using the ThroughAssociation.

member.summary: Indicates if this entity is read-only.
member.remarks: A transient entity will not have any changes persisted when calling SaveChanges() from a UnitOfWork and will not participate in any cascade delete operations if related to a non transient entity which is being removed.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.MetaData.EntityInfo.IsVersioned
member.summary: Indicates if this entity is versioned for optimistic concurrency.
member.remarks: A versioned entity holds a LockVersion value in the database which is checked when the entity is saved. A mismatch between version numbers will throw an OptimisticConcurrencyException.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.MetaData.EntityInfo.Fields
member.summary: Returns a list of the fields defined on entities of this type.
member.remarks: A field in LightSpeed refers to all fields held on the entity which includes value holders, transient fields and all associations

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.MetaData.EntityInfo.ValueFields
member.summary: Returns a list of the value holder fields defined on entities of this type.
member.remarks: A value holder field in LightSpeed is a field which is not transient and not an association and holds a value which is persisted to a database backed column.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.MetaData.EntityInfo.FlattenedFields
member.summary: Returns a list of all fields which are held by the inheritance chain that this entity participates in.
member.remarks: This differs from the Fields collection in that it includes fields from derived and sibling classes. Because these fields are not defined on the entity at hand, they cannot necessarily be used to obtain field values.

member.name: P:Mindscape.LightSpeed.MetaData.EntityInfo.FlattenedValueFields
member.summary: Returns a list of all value holder fields which are held by the inheritance chain that this entity participates in.
member.remarks: This differs from the ValueFields collection in that it includes fields from derived and sibling classes. Because these fields are not defined on the entity at hand, they cannot necessarily be used to obtain field values.
